bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 44 (Monday, March 16, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WALZ:H.R. 1384.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to Section 8 of Article I ofthe United States Constitution.____________________[Page H1662]

item.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 0 (Roll no. 628). (text: CR H8175-8176)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 0 (Roll no. 628).(text: CR H8175-8176)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H8211)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1384.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H8175-8176)
Mr. Costello (PA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 229.
Reported by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 114-302.
Reported by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 114-302.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

item.fullName: Rep. Carney, John C., Jr. [D-DE-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 1384, Honor America’s Guard-Reserve Retirees Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs on September 17, 2015

summary.text:
Honor America's Guard-Reserve Retirees Act

Honors as a veteran any person who is entitled to retired pay for nonregular (reserve) service or who, but for age, would be so entitled. Provides that such person shall not be entitled to any benefit by reason of such recognition.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Honor America's Guard-Reserve Retirees Act

(Sec. 2) Any person who is entitled to retired pay for nonregular (reserve) service or who, but for age, would be so entitled shall be honored as a veteran.

A person shall not be entitled to any benefit by reason of such recognition.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House reported version is repeated here.)

Honor America's Guard-Reserve Retirees Act

(Sec. 2) Any person who is entitled to retired pay for nonregular (reserve) service or who, but for age, would be so entitled shall be honored as a veteran.

A person shall not be entitled to any benefit by reason of such recognition.

bill.title: Honor America's Guard-Reserve Retirees Act

item.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to recognize the service in the reserve components of certain persons by honoring them with status as veterans under law.

item.titleType: Short Titles as Reported to House

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
